jdbc.query

Class OccasionalQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdbc.query.OccasionalQueries

  • public class OccasionalQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for querying, inserting, and updating occasional visit orders in the database. Occasional orders are those not made in advance and typically involve visitors who arrive without a pre-existing reservation.
    Author:
    Tamer Amer, Gal Bitton, Rabea Lahham, Bahaldeen Swied, Ron Sisso, Nadav Reubens.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OccasionalQueries

        public OccasionalQueries()

    • Method Detail

      • FetchOccasioanlOrderById

        public ServerResponse FetchOccasioanlOrderById(Order order)
        Fetches an occasional visit order by its ID from the database. This method is useful for retrieving details about a specific occasional visit that has been recorded.
        Parameters:
        order - An Order object that contains the ID of the occasional visit order to be fetched.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponse enum indicating the outcome of the operation (e.g., Order_Found, Order_Not_Found, Query_Failed).

      • ReturnTotalOccasionalVisits

        public int ReturnTotalOccasionalVisits()
        Calculates the total number of occasional visits recorded in the database. This includes all occasional visits, regardless of their current status.
        Returns:
        The total number of occasional visits as an integer.

      • ReturnTotalOccasionalVisitsInPark

        public int ReturnTotalOccasionalVisitsInPark()
        Determines the total number of occasional visitors currently present in the park. This count includes only those visitors whose orders are marked as 'In Park'.
        Returns:
        The total number of occasional visitors currently in the park.

      • UpdateOccasionalOrderStatus

        public boolean UpdateOccasionalOrderStatus(Order order,
                                           OrderStatusEnum status)
        Gets an occasional order and status to update, updates the order with the requested status
        Parameters:
        order - - the order to search for, must include the orderId
        status - - status to update order with
        Returns:
        on Success: returns Order_ExitDate_Updated on Failure: returns Failed exception: returns Exception_Was_Thrown

      • UpdateOrderExitDate

        public ServerResponse UpdateOrderExitDate(Order order,
                                          java.time.LocalDateTime exitDate)
        Gets an occasional order and exit date time, updates the order exit date time accordingly
        Parameters:
        order - - the order to search for, must include the orderId
        exitDate - - the date time to update
        Returns:
        on Success: returns Order_ExitDate_Updated on Failure: returns Failed exception: returns Exception_Was_Thrown

      • insertOccasionalOrder

        public ServerResponse insertOccasionalOrder(Order order)
        Inserts a new occasional visit order into the database. This method is used to record the details of a new occasional visit, including the visitor's information and visit details.
        Parameters:
        order - The new occasional visit order to be added to the database.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponse enum indicating the outcome of the operation (e.g., Occasional_Visit_Added_Successfully, Query_Failed).

      • getAllOccasionalOrdersInPark

        public java.util.ArrayList<Order> getAllOccasionalOrdersInPark(int parkId)
        Retrieves all occasional visit orders for a specific park that are marked as 'In Park' on the current date. This method is useful for obtaining a list of all visitors currently in the park on an occasional visit.
        Parameters:
        parkId - The ID of the park for which to retrieve the occasional visit orders.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Order objects representing all occasional visitors currently in the specified park; null if there are none or in case of an error.
